title: @Meddler, Turrets are depressingly weak, and still getting a nerf on PBE. Why?
body:
Ok, so the first turret feels like a small achievement when you bring it down, because a lot of that success is based on the performance of the lane + help from the jungler.
The rest of the turrets in game are pathetic, especially inhibitor turrets and nexus turrets. Even squishies can stand under and absorb plenty of damage. Nothing is worse than seeing a Tryndamere or Jinx just rip a turret down like it is wet tissue paper. 
And don't even get me started on turrets not focusing champs when they dive you. This is still a recurring and occasional bug, and I have lost ranked games because of this. 

Turrets should be much more threatening. 
I remember when I started playing, very late into season 3. I regarded turrets as deadly towers which I could be safe under. Those days seem long gone. 

Nexus turrets should essentially feel like their team needs to be aced in order to take them down, instead of these pathetic lasers that we currently have. They should also destroy squishies very fast. 

Riot, please give huge buffs to base turrets.
Would like to also hear the official stance on turrets from a Rioter who is part of the balance team.
All discussion welcome.

replies.body:
We originally added the slow (and a -damage mod) to the Nexus/Inihb towers as an anti split pushing effect, at a time where we were concerned that split push was leading to low interaction games. That's currently not the case however, very much the opposite in fact, with heavy team fight comps crowding out split push almost entirely. We're not looking to make split pushing a staple of every game, but do think we've limited it too much, hence the removal of those effects.

In terms of the broader purpose of towers it is intended that the risk they pose to enemy champions decreases over the course of the game. Early on they're zones of sanctuary, where it's extremely risky to try and go in for a kill much of the time. Over time they transition to a helper role instead. Towers will turn the tide of a close fight, but they're not going to be more dangerous than an enemy champion anymore. Late game in particular, once everyone's past the individual laning period, it's the presence of teammates instead that provides substantial zones of safety/support. Powerful late game towers, particularly if they can be held by a couple of champions against a full enemy team, result in slower, drawn out, low risk/interaction games.

I don't understand how the slow effect was ever suppose to counter split pushing - in fact, it usually acts to counter team fight comps that engage under tower. 

Darn it, the slow was one of my favourite changes in the Preseason and this was playing against it as well as having it on my side - because the results were instantly measurable. The first time I tower dove for a kill and the tower slowed me down to the point I was unable to get in range AND DIED, I exclaimed in Skype "OMFG this stupid turret!" and my mate replied "Well you shouldn't have dove the enemies' base...". And I knew that. I knew I was being reckless for no reason. I felt like I was appropriately punished for making the wrong choice - and watching it happen over and over again still gives me good feels in my belly - e.g. you see their healthy fighter flash under tower and you flash away yourself and watching them struggle to disengage from their greedy decision (especially on champions like Diana with the slow-moving animation to really sell it). Sometimes the slow even helps you get away - making it the only turret that actually feels helpful to hide behind.

Remove the damage reduction if this turret really is stopping split pushers. But don't remove the slow. Q_Q

Maybe give it a backdoor-plating like effect? "If this turret selects an enemy champion as a target due to aggression on an ally, for the next 5 seconds its attacks are empowered to also reduce its target's damage by 15%." and make the lasers go thick and red (danger) rather than their usual amber.

EDIT: If you want a way to prevent stalling late game - maybe add a way to interact with the base gates? Maybe they can be destroyed just like any other structure (but respawn like an inhibitor) - or tie them into inhibitor deaths.

I agree with this. The removal of *two* factors is what makes this change worse. I believe nexus towers are weak enough, (just watch any game and watch it go real fast) but this change was totally unnecessary.

I don't see how **anyone** can enjoy playing against the turret slow. I hate that mechanic...it always baits me in. I think "man I can kill this weakling...I'm fed! Who cares about a little slow and damage reduction!" So I dive and then get my ass kited to hell and back, and I end up dying while they live with like 100 health. It's so freaking annoying. I hate anything in this game that promotes playing like a little bitch who just hides under their big bad turret jacking off. It's freaking insulting when they send their weakest team member to stave me off, and they know they can do it cause the turret is so OP. I'm all for this change.

Not gonna lie - you're exactly the reason I enjoy having that turret. You were greedy and overconfident and you got played. It also makes it a necessary evil because why should you be able to single-handedly carry a game? There should always be options for the enemy team - and if goading you under the only useful turrets on the map deals with you, then good. ^_^

The slow on the towers hurt split pushers because it made it far more difficult to dive and kill an enemy that tries to defend the tower. That is something strong split pushers need to be able to do. Any split pusher that can be held off easily 1v1 is worthless. As for nerfing the towers, yes, they will technically help tanks since it doesn't hurt them as much, it will help split pushers more, which hurts tanks.

The slow allowed champions to kite under the turret if they started to get dived.

This meant a large portion of champions who were strong enough late game to dive and kill you under turret were just being kited in circles and they had to instead kill the turret while not being murdered by their opponent while they wailed on it.  Just as your story depicts, it *WORKED* and arguably too well.

As Meddler stated, 

> Powerful late game towers, particularly if they can be held by a couple of champions against a full enemy team, result in slower, drawn out, low risk/interaction games.
>

Do you at least understand that it's a huge buff to Tanks ?

I mean, slow was one of the only way to prevent from 30 seconds diving, now they're just gonna make a walk like nothing happened ...

Yes, make these anti-turret siege items actually worthwhile to buy and use. Currently the turrets are just too weak to even bother needing to buy a single item or two to help stop a siege just because the the turrets are incredibly weak and easy to dive. 

Making the turrets stronger will actually make these items worth buying, increasing their "diversity" and overall game strategy. We have the items to counter strong turrets. People just don't want to buy them because they don't have to.

Also IMO i just think the laser turrets should not loose their heat when changing targets and switch targets quicker. But that's just a side off-topic comment, move along.

currently there are two major problems from my perspective:

- towers aren´t a "zone of sanctuary" early on, 2v1 dives are really easy to do even on lvl 3 vs too many Champions...and looking at the prolvl - i donßt think it´s fair that you cannot defend a turret 3v4 if the 4 don´t missplay it heavily (which by the way is why currently it often ends up with 4-0 pushing again, as trying to defend turrets early on is just suicide). It also heavily limits the amount of viable sololane-champs, as everyone that is vulnerable to early diving is just too risky often times. Shifting the Shield from the 2nd to the 1st turret could help a lot here.

- towers don´t deal substantial more dmg to squishies than they do to tanks. They have too much armor-pen and by far not enough base-dmg. with just a warmogs you can tank them aslong as someone with a ruby cristall, a thornmail and a randuins combined. 
It´s also one of the very reasons Assassins snowball as hard and feel as frustrating for a lot of players like they do currently - if you´re ahead only slightly with LB you can easily take 3 turret-hits when diving and still get away with it as one of the squishiest champs there is. 
Tanking turrets should be primarily a main reason to bring a tank along in the first place.

It´s not the turrets that prolong games, it´s players that shy away from every risk because you overhype K/D/A instead of results.

While I agree with many of your points I want to point out that moving the shield from second to the first turret is a really bad idea. While it would be frustrating for mid and top I think bot lane would take it the hardest. Shoving the wave in and then harassing the opponent under the turret to make them take damage and miss cs is a really common and cool strategy. In fact it's a large part of bot lane interaction. But with the shield then all of a sudden that auto-harass could just be ignored at first. This would just make the lanes more boring because for anything to happen people would just try to keep the wave frozen in the middle.

that depends on the tuneing, and it would help one of the major toplane problems: heavy snowballing and massive bullying from ranged vs melee.
Tuneing the tower shield so that it needs two AAs from ranged champs in the early till they have some ad, it would help to actually be somewhat save under the tower.
However, if the enemie as+sup(like cait+lulu) each do one AA on the tower after shoving in, the shield would be gone and they could harras as usually, just with slightly more effort, which is good imo.
You could also make the shield a bit yasuo like, vanashing ~1.5sec after takeing damage and then needing to built up, so only the first Burst is blocked so helping little vs harres but more vs dives, building up faster for melees as they need more protection vs ranged poke earlyrather than vs all-in dives.
Haveing lower ranged and getting shoved into your turrent and reciving harras every time you try to CS is one of the least fun things in lol, and all that currently helps in such a situation is your jungle, which in soloQ isn't reliable, getting a bit more protection, especially as melee, would really help the game.

I really like the idea of the yasuo-like shield that would give people csing under turret a little protection while not removing the harass as a viable option. Maybe the shield can either be broken by 2-3 autos on the turret OR 2 seconds after damage is dealt to the champion with the shield on them. Possibly the champs get a larger shield than the turret does.

 Looking at it like that I actually like the idea because it gives counterplay for people on the defensive and pressures them to make use of their advantage before it gets negated. 

Also this would help to reward mid/top laners for freezing the wave by shielding them from some of the harass making people with poor early games a little more viable (there might need to be some tuning on champs if that makes them too strong). 

Best thing, is that it's a free counter to Riven spamming her turret dive ;)
I think that overly-favors playing defense. If the aggressive side is wide open to ganks, there should be reward to that risk as far as sieging is concerned.

in soloQ, thats a valid concern, but in coordinated teams, pushing out with a toplaner that doesn't have good tools to survive ganks is gegnerally a big mistake, unless your jungler is around for a counter gank.
In order to reward agressive laneing, laners(especially at top) need better tools to avoid ganks, else only champs with massive escape like riven or renekton can afford to go agressive, and even they have to be carefully as they need there engage also for escape.

As a long time Dota player I feel that without some way to quickly get to a turret for defense this can be detrimental. I recently won a game simply by having my team sit around the enemy's blue 20s before dragon spawned and instead of contesting dragon we just bum rushed thier turret/inhib while they took dragon. I also have friends who have made it from silver to diamond simply playing tryndamere and hitting turrets and hiding in a bush when enemies defend.

As someone who is use to having an entire team able to tp to a tower for defense at a moment's notice, the particularly weak towers in LoL seem very abusable. Also worth mentioning that teamfight comps may be the norm in LCS/Pro play but i'm not so sure that tend holds when looking at overall public games where I see Nasus/Trynd and other split pushers almost every game.

The anti-split push effect doesn't really do anything as far as the nexus turrets are concerned IMO. 
If they are almost about to attack the Nexus itself, its either due to an ace or a successful baron (these minions destroy towers fast, especially cannon minions) or you are outnumbered.
A full tank Sion should be fine to a certain extent under these turrets, but ADCs and assassins should be melted. Also, like already mentioned, this is a big buff to tanks, but even more for squishy champions. 

From a thematic standpoint, it doesn't make sense that the most important objective on the map is protected by the weakest turrets, which is a shame. 

This nerf to towers will make games snowball even harder now.

The reality here is that the slow and damage reduction is much more valuable in teamfights that it is aganist splitpushing.

So as a part of diversity you buff teamfighting which is already strong.

Way. To. Go.
At least keep or buff the slow? The turrets feel not very punishing as it is, I like the fact that they at least had some weak slow as a utility to help your team out.

I think a current issue with making turrets weak as they are, especially now with the removal of the laser turrets' debuffs, is that they feel bad even at a time where players expect them to be strong. Hard-pushing a lane and reaching an inhibitor turret within 10-15 minutes tends to be a rare thing, but even in that situation the inhibitor turrets feel relatively weak. There's also a lot of frustration with tower dives, I think: players are conditioned to feel that turrets will always offer a last line of defense during the laning phase, but from level 6 and onwards even squishy champions can dive targets and make it out alive.

I think there's a distinction here that needs to be made between the different aspects of turrets, namely their damage output and their tankiness. Tankier turrets would definitely stall out games, since it would take more resources for each structure to fall, but increasing their damage or other effects might offer more protection in the right situations without creating unhealthy amounts of stalling. If you made laser turrets deal maximum health-scaling true damage which ramped up over time, for example, it would have a minimal effect in discouraging splitpushing, but would prevent tanks from building tons of health and just sitting under those turrets indefinitely during teamfights. In general, health-stacking feels a bit too good against turrets, and now that health options are far more accessible, and often very powerful, I feel turrets have become weaker as a consequence.

Has there been any consideration to changing the early game power level of turrets?
I agree that they should be a place of sanctuary early,  diving should be strongly deterred. Yet I find their power isn't like this at all. 

Even pre-6, supports will tank the turret in 2v1 dives bot Lane. Often someone will tank a couple hits during a jungle gank.  Successfully taking anything more than 1 turret shot during a dive pre-6 should be reserved for the very few champs that have something in their kit to encourage diving...

On the other hand,  I find trying to take that first turret to be very frustrating. I can be winning Lane pretty consistently where my opponent refuses to feed me and just bases repeatedly early game. So I push the lane in and do some turret damage each time,  yet it never seems to add up. Eventually their turret is at half health and mine's not yet touched and I get ganked and escape to recall and my turret is destroyed before I get back. They've recalled under pressure 5 times and I've only got theirs to half health, the first time i recall without pushing out the wave first I  lose the whole thing. It happens because there seems to be this point where champions suddenly start to deal a lot more damage to turrets and the enemy has their jungler helping to take it down. 

What I want is:
Early game turrets to be more threatening when a champion is there. Dives should be strongly discouraged unless the enemy is nearly dead and you're nearly full. 
Early game turrets to be easier to take. Reward people who win push out a safe opponent who refuses to give up kills (specifically weak roamers who can't get kills elsewhere).

I'd suggest making a change to Tier 1 turrets:
1 - increased damage to champions when an allied champion is under the turret. If an allied champion moves within the turret range,  the turret gains 10% bonus damage to champions per second stacking up to 5 seconds (the bonus could be altered). This makes chasing someone into their turret unchanged,  but makes diving someone more risky once they've safely been at their turret for a while (i.e. you're waiting for your jungler to come tank it).
2 - bonus damage against turrets. If no allied champion is within a larger range of a Tier 1 turret,  the first champion to attack the turret receives a buff that increases their damage against turrets for a few seconds. Either on-hit, or attack speed boost, or otherwise. 

I think this would transform turrets in to what they spoils be early game. Places of safety for a defender,  but a key objective to take when your enemy surrenders map pressure. Not everyone can roam or take Dragon whenever they push the enemy out of lane.

I disagree with this. I think turrets need to be somewhat weak. Diving them should be a risk, but if they are too strong then games will not end. I don't like that idea. 

I actually quite like the way they are balanced now. When I dive I know there is a risk but also know that if the team plays well or we are far enough ahead we can do it.

Its less about the risk and more about the fact they are near useless late game other than something to slightly slow the process of knocking an inhibitor down and spawning super minions. Obviously a 4v1 dive is the end of the line for the one person, and thats ok. 
But 1v1 dives could and maybe should be more punishing. I don't mean when the defender is on 23 health, I mean when half the health bar is still there. Without a Zhonyas, a Zed or LeBlanc won't think twice about it, which will earn you a grey screen and a free trip back to the fountain. I suppose that is where outplaying comes into mind. Not too sure about first turrets or even second turrets, but that isn't the core issue here. 

The main problem is the laser turrets.

Those lasers give squishies a gentle tickle late game, which is not OK. The niche for tanks is that they should have less to fear from turrets. The removal of the slow on PBE means that they can take less damage from walking away without being slowed.

In all honesty, I'm going to take the opinion that they should be pretty weak late game. Otherwise, you end up with three scenarios.

1) Games going for exceedingly long times because teams can't rush towers
2) A super tank meta emerging to deal with the turrets
3) Stall comps that rely on the last defenses to hold out until their late game carry is fed to the brim.

I've always felt that turrets have 3 'stages'. Early game, they're a defense, a primary means of safety. Mid game, they're an aid, something to help a sieged team. Late game, they're a deterrent, something that might make the enemy team think atleast once before rushing, but it isn't a huge benefit.  

Also, not sure why people think the lasers are weak, the damage adds up. I think after 2-3 seconds they start to vastly outdamage other turrets.

I feel like the damage to tanks is almost balanced to be honest. They stand on it for a little bit and then they start getting melted really fast. The inhib and nexus turrets could use slight buffs so they ramp up faster, but they're not really in a bad spot versus tanks in my opinion.

I think the main issue with the turrets is that they do almost no damage to squishies. It's so bad that the enemy carry can dive pretty tanky people and get away with it. Then they walk out, auto attack a minion about four times and they're back at full hp thanks to lifesteal.

Tanks can stand under the towers for a long time, yes, but they probably aren't going to heal all of their hp back in 3 seconds afterwards.

Another issue with the towers is juggling agro. Because the damage has to ramp up, you can tank the tower for a couple of seconds, walk out, have someone else tank it, and then walk back in and tank some more because the tower just reset its damage. 

This brings me back to the first point, which is that the towers should ramp up faster. It currently takes 5 seconds for the inhib and nexus towers to charge up to max damage. I think the towers would be a lot better with a 4 second charge time instead (20% faster yay) because the faster charge time would help address basically every problem the towers have without making them overbearing or too strong.
